answers.answer:
Foreign nationals or stateless persons coming from the area of armed conflict in Ukraine, and asylum seekers are eligible for medical assistance in Romania. Specific support is also available for refugees from Ukraine with conditions like HIV, rare/chronic diseases, cancer, or for women and children.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the sections "My rights Temporary protection & Short stay," "Asylum seeker," "Medical assistance to refugees from Ukraine in Romania," and other specialized sections like "Women's Center," "Pediatric oncology," "Counseling for people living with HIV," and "Help for people with rare or chronic diseases."
answers.bResponse:
Foreign nationals or stateless persons coming from the area of armed conflict in Ukraine, and asylum seekers are eligible for medical assistance in Romania. Specific support is also available for refugees from Ukraine with conditions like HIV, rare/chronic diseases, cancer, or for women and children.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the sections "My rights Temporary protection & Short stay," "Asylum seeker," "Medical assistance to refugees from Ukraine in Romania," and other specialized sections like "Women's Center," "Pediatric oncology," "Counseling for people living with HIV," and "Help for people with rare or chronic diseases." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate

answers.answer:
Foreign nationals from Ukraine can access a wide range of medical services including general and specialized outpatient care, emergency medical assistance, and treatment for acute or chronic life-threatening illnesses. Services also cover reproductive health, pediatric oncology, HIV psycho-medical-social services, care for rare or chronic diseases, dental services, and various gynecological consultations, often provided without contributions or co-payments.

To find detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the sections such as "My rights Temporary protection & Short stay", "Asylum seeker", "Medical assistance to refugees from Ukraine in Romania", "Women's Center", "Pediatric oncology", "Counseling for people living with HIV", "Help for people with rare or chronic diseases", and specific services like "The Society for Education on Contraception and Sexuality (SECS)" and "Children’s health".
answers.bResponse:
Foreign nationals from Ukraine can access a wide range of medical services including general and specialized outpatient care, emergency medical assistance, and treatment for acute or chronic life-threatening illnesses. Services also cover reproductive health, pediatric oncology, HIV psycho-medical-social services, care for rare or chronic diseases, dental services, and various gynecological consultations, often provided without contributions or co-payments.

To find detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the sections such as "My rights Temporary protection & Short stay", "Asylum seeker", "Medical assistance to refugees from Ukraine in Romania", "Women's Center", "Pediatric oncology", "Counseling for people living with HIV", "Help for people with rare or chronic diseases", and specific services like "The Society for Education on Contraception and Sexuality (SECS)" and "Children’s health". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate

answers.answer:
Ukrainian nationals fleeing the conflict in Ukraine are exempt from paying social health insurance contributions, personal contributions for outpatient medicines, and co-payments for medical services. Asylum seekers are entitled to free basic and emergency medical assistance.

To find more detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and refer to the sections titled "My rights Temporary protection & Short stay" and "Free medical care for people fleeing the war in Ukraine."
answers.bResponse:
Ukrainian nationals fleeing the conflict in Ukraine are exempt from paying social health insurance contributions, personal contributions for outpatient medicines, and co-payments for medical services. Asylum seekers are entitled to free basic and emergency medical assistance.

To find more detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and refer to the sections titled "My rights Temporary protection & Short stay" and "Free medical care for people fleeing the war in Ukraine." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate

answers.answer:
No, a referral is not needed to access specialized outpatient healthcare.

To find this information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the section titled "My rights Temporary protection & Short stay" for foreign nationals from Ukraine.
answers.bResponse:
No, a referral is not needed to access specialized outpatient healthcare.

To find this information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the section titled "My rights Temporary protection & Short stay" for foreign nationals from Ukraine. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate

answers.answer:
As an asylum seeker, you are entitled to free basic medical assistance and treatment, emergency medical assistance in a hospital, and free medical treatment for acute/chronic illnesses that pose an immediate risk to life. If you have special medical needs, you also have the right to receive proper medical care based on your condition.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and look under the section titled "Asylum seeker".
answers.bResponse:
As an asylum seeker, you are entitled to free basic medical assistance and treatment, emergency medical assistance in a hospital, and free medical treatment for acute/chronic illnesses that pose an immediate risk to life. If you have special medical needs, you also have the right to receive proper medical care based on your condition.

To find this information on the webpage, go to https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and look under the section titled "Asylum seeker". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate

answers.answer:
Yes, there are services available for reproductive health, including contraception, pregnancy monitoring, and abortion, as well as support services specifically dedicated to victims of domestic violence.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and look under the "Women's Center" section for both reproductive health services and support for victims of domestic violence. You can also find more information on gynecology medical services for women and girls from Ukraine in Bucharest under "The Society for Education on Contraception and Sexuality (SECS)."

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and look under the "Women's Center" section for both reproductive health services and support for victims of domestic violence. You can also find more information on gynecology medical services for women and girls from Ukraine in Bucharest under "The Society for Education on Contraception and Sexuality (SECS)." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate

answers.answer:
Families of Ukrainian children with cancer can find medical assistance by accessing "Ukraine Child Cancer Help."

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate` and read under the "Pediatric oncology" section.

answers.answer:
Yes, there are psycho-medical-social services and treatment available for people living with HIV in Romania, including a dedicated call center.

To find detailed information, go to the website dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and look under the sections titled "Counseling for people living with HIV" and "Call center Sens Pozitiv HIV treatment or services for those coming from Ukraine".

answers.answer:
Individuals with rare or chronic diseases can receive specialized medical assistance and support. The National Alliance for Rare Diseases Romania, in collaboration with EURORDIS, provides guidance and support, and the NoRo center in Zalău offers free therapy for children.

To find more detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the section "Help for people with rare or chronic diseases".
answers.bResponse:
Individuals with rare or chronic diseases can receive specialized medical assistance and support. The National Alliance for Rare Diseases Romania, in collaboration with EURORDIS, provides guidance and support, and the NoRo center in Zalău offers free therapy for children.

To find more detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the section "Help for people with rare or chronic diseases". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate

answers.answer:
Yes, women and girls from Ukraine can access gynecology medical services in Bucharest, facilitated by the Society for Education on Contraception and Sexuality (SECS). They can help with appointments, clinic assistance, communication with doctors, and consultation settlement for various gynecological services.

To find this information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and look under the section "Free medical care for people fleeing the war in Ukraine," where details about SECS services are provided.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, women and girls from Ukraine can access gynecology medical services in Bucharest, facilitated by the Society for Education on Contraception and Sexuality (SECS). They can help with appointments, clinic assistance, communication with doctors, and consultation settlement for various gynecological services.

To find this information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and look under the section "Free medical care for people fleeing the war in Ukraine," where details about SECS services are provided. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate

answers.answer:
It is stated that continued breastfeeding for babies and a balanced diet for children are extremely necessary for their well-being and immunity, even if access to various products is limited in emergencies. A dedicated chapter provides guidance on organizing food and food stocks more efficiently.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sanatate and read under the section "Children’s health. Health services for children. Children’s nutrition".
